Acolyte.name: Fate Must Wait
Acolyte.description: Resurrect anyone in your party.

Acolyte.name: Divinity Undone
Acolyte.description: Unlock and read the [Book of Dead Gods](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Book_of_Dead_Gods).

Acolyte.name: Silvanus' Solitude
Acolyte.description: Witness the ritual that seals off the [grove](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Secluded_Grove) from the world.

Acolyte.name: Her Gift of Silver
Acolyte.description:
Recover [Selûne](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Deities#Selûne)'s lost treasure through prayer.
Read the [prayer note](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sel%C3%BBnite_Prayer_Sheet) while next to the locked chest.

Acolyte.name: A Kiss Without Mercy
Acolyte.description: Endure the ritual of Loviatar until [Abdirak](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Abdirak) is pleased.

Acolyte.name: A Unified Spirit
Acolyte.description:
Pray with the Flaming Fists at Waukeen's Rest.
The option to do this is only available to [Clerics](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Cleric) of good-aligned deities and [Paladins](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Paladin).

Acolyte.name: Last Rites of the Dark Dancer
Acolyte.description: Complete [Eilistraee](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Deities#Eilistraee)'s ritual of sorrow and obtain her [blessed blade](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Phalar_Aluve).

Acolyte.name: Tipping the Scales
Acolyte.description:
Earn the worship of the [Kuo-toa](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Kuo-toa).
Also granted by convincing [BOOOAL](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/BOOOAL) to let you kill in his name.

Acolyte.name: Acolytes of the Demonweb Pits
Acolyte.description: Persuade the spiders in Grymforge to remain faithful to Lolth.

Acolyte.name: No Rest for the Wicked
Acolyte.description: Assist [He Who Was](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/He_Who_Was) in his task.

Acolyte.name: Moonweaver's Prayer
Acolyte.description: Witness [Isobel](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Isobel_Thorm)'s ritual to keep up the protection of Last Light.

Acolyte.name: Blessed's Final Rest
Acolyte.description: Find the [aasimar's journal](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Olam%27s_Journal).

Acolyte.name: In Her Footsteps
Acolyte.description: Solve each of Shar's trials in the Gauntlet of Shar.

Acolyte.name: Cerimonia Alārum
Acolyte.description: Release the [Nightsong](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Find_the_Nightsong).

Acolyte.name: A Piece of Three
Acolyte.description: Piece together Ketheric's allegiances.

Acolyte.name: Needs of the Many
Acolyte.description: Persuade the [merchant](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Arfur_Gregorio) to let the refugee squatters stay in his home.

Acolyte.name: Carnal Rituals of Sharess
Acolyte.description: Take part in the... erm... negotiable affection provided in [Sharess' Caress](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sharess%27_Caress).

Acolyte.name: Shaking Bane's Hand
Acolyte.description: Agree to an alliance with [Gortash](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gortash).

Acolyte.name: Ordinary Practises in Extraordinary Times
Acolyte.description:
Offer appropriate offerings to a deity in the [Stormshore Tabernacle](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Stormshore_Tabernacle).
The offering is the same amount as needed to get a merchant to 100 Attitude as seen [here](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Trading_and_item_pricing#Trader_attitude).

Acolyte.name: Liturgy of Blood
Acolyte.description: Embrace Bhaal and complete the [Murder Tribunal](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Impress_the_Murder_Tribunal).

Acolyte.name: Grinning with Bhaal
Acolyte.description: Agree to an alliance with [Orin](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Orin).

Charlatan.name: Cheese Your Way Through
Charlatan.description: Talk your way past the bandits and enter the [chapel](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Chapel_Entrance).

Charlatan.name: Flexible Diplomacy
Charlatan.description: Betray the tieflings after convincing them to free [Lae'zel](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lae%27zel).

Charlatan.name: Just Passing Through
Charlatan.description: Trick the goblins in Moonhaven.

Charlatan.name: Very Important Parasite
Charlatan.description: Deceive any of the guards in the goblin camp.

Charlatan.name: Devil's Advocate
Charlatan.description: Interrogate the [dead mind flayer](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Shattered_Sanctum#Ragzlin's_throne) without drawing suspicion.

Charlatan.name: Silver Blades, Silver Tongue
Charlatan.description: Convince [Kith'rak Voss](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Kith%27rak_Voss) to leave without violence.

Charlatan.name: The Importance of Networking
Charlatan.description: Talk your way into the [Zhentarim hideout](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Zhentarim_Basement).

Charlatan.name: One of Us
Charlatan.description: Use the [hag's mask](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Whispering_Mask) to peacefully bypass her thralls.

Charlatan.name: Warmonger
Charlatan.description: Cause [Glut](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Glut) to stage a coup - then pick a side.

Charlatan.name: A Friend to All
Charlatan.description: Gain access to Grymforge peacefully by lying to the [raft patrol](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Greymon).

Charlatan.name: Not My First Time
Charlatan.description: Resist the truth serum when talking to [Jaheira](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Jaheira). (Suggestion: Inspiration isn't triggering anymore?)

Charlatan.name: Clear Conscience
Charlatan.description: Successfully lie to [Z'rell](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Z%27rell) about the fate of the goblins.

Charlatan.name: Not to Worry, I Have a Permit
Charlatan.description:
Evade repercussions when speaking to the Moonrise prisoners.
Can be achieved by persuading the guards to let the party talk to the prisoners, by talking to the prisoners unobserved, or by killing all the guards and then talking to a prisoner.

Charlatan.name: Little White Lies
Charlatan.description: Lie to [Arabella](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Arabella) about the [fate of her parents](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Find_Arabella%27s_Parents).

Charlatan.name: Tricks of the Trade
Charlatan.description:
Successfully pretend to drink from the steins of ale.
During dialog with [Thisobald Thorm](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Thisobald_Thorm), pass both [Sleight of Hand](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sleight_of_Hand) checks to feign drinking.

Charlatan.name: Takes One to Know One
Charlatan.description:
Expose the true form of the [toll collector](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gerringothe_Thorm) by removing all her gold armour.
This requires killing all her Visages in combat.

Charlatan.name: The Devil's in the Details
Charlatan.description: Expose a half-truth in the [orthon's contract](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Break_Yurgir%27s_Contract) with Raphael.

Charlatan.name: Morally Grey
Charlatan.description: Betray the trust of Moonrise or Lastlight.

Charlatan.name: Stuffed Bears in the Closet
Charlatan.description: Blackmail the [merchant](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Arfur_Gregorio).

Charlatan.name: Cheating the Cheater
Charlatan.description:
Find the source of the genie's trick and take it.
Pickpocket the [Djinni Ring](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Djinni_Ring) from [Akabi](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Akabi) and then win the jackpot.

Charlatan.name: Rock-Solid Alibi
Charlatan.description: Manage to convince the Flaming Fist to let you into Wyrm's Rock.

Charlatan.name: Nothing's Not for Sale
Charlatan.description: Convince the [Flaming Fist quartermaster](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Arkleia_Oloril) to trade with you.

Charlatan.name: Friends in Low Places
Charlatan.description: Gain access to the [Undercellar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Guildhall) through [Tusgront](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Tusgront).

Charlatan.name: Silver-Tongue's Better Than Any Key
Charlatan.description:
Gain access to Avery's workshop.
The workshop is on the upper floors of Felogyr's Fireworks. You can either sneak in or gain access with the password obtained during [Investigate the Suspicious Toys](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Investigate_the_Suspicious_Toys).

Charlatan.name: Always Trust a Dishonest Person
Charlatan.description:
Betray a recently forged alliance.
Mutually exclusive with Inspirations with the same name in Act 3. To unlock this Inspiration enter combat against [Mystic Carrion](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mystic_Carrion) after obtaining the quest [Find Mystic Carrion's Servant](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Find_Mystic_Carrion%27s_Servant). The Inspiration is still be rewarded even after the aforementioned quest is completed in favor of Mystic Carrion. The only prerequisite is for the party to engage in hostilities by attacking Mystic Carrion directly, it does not work if the undead is already hostile (eg. by destroying its [heart](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Jar_of_Mystic_Carrion%27s_Heart)).

Charlatan.name: The News of My Deeds Was Greatly Exaggerated
Charlatan.description:
Rig the Baldur's Mouth printing press.
Complete the quest [Stop the Presses](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Stop_the_Presses).

Charlatan.name: Grave Prospector
Charlatan.description: Retrieve the grave's gold from [Bugthimble](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Bugthimble).

Charlatan.name: Perks of the Trade
Charlatan.description: Obtain a rebate for your room at the Elfsong Tavern.

Charlatan.name: Woman of Her Word
Charlatan.description:
Side with the [Nine-Fingers](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Nine-Fingers) against the [Zhentarim](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Zhentarim).
At the conclusion of [Aid the Underduke](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Aid_the_Underduke), support Nine-Fingers.

Charlatan.name: Always Trust a Dishonest Person
Charlatan.description:
Betray a recently forged alliance.
Mutually exclusive with Inspirations with the same name in Act 3. Betray [Nightsong](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Aylin) to [Lorroakan](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lorroakan).

Charlatan.name: Always Trust a Dishonest Person
Charlatan.description:
Betray a recently forged alliance.
Mutually exclusive with Inspirations with the same name in Act 3. Face [Orin](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Orin) in the Bhaal Temple without killing Gortash after telling Orin that you would.

Charlatan.name: Always Trust a Dishonest Person
Charlatan.description:
Betray a recently forged alliance.
Mutually exclusive with Inspirations with the same name in Act 3. Refuse [The Emperor](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/The_Emperor) and release [Orpheus](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Orpheus).

Criminal.name: A Fine Fortune
Criminal.description: Steal an item worth at least 1000 gold.

Criminal.name: Culling the Crowd
Criminal.description: Use poison to kill the drunk goblins in camp.

Criminal.name: A Fine Fortune
Criminal.description: Steal Runepowder Barrel from [Philomeen](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Philomeen) before conversation.

Criminal.name: Shiny Trinkets and Baubles
Criminal.description:
Take [the drider's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Kar%27niss) Moonlantern.
Must be done via Deception checks during the convoy ambush, or by disarming him and picking it up mid-combat; not just killing him and looting the lantern.

Criminal.name: A Dark Edge
Criminal.description:
Take Shar's [dagger](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ritual_Dagger_of_Shar) from the ritual pedestal.
The pedestal is found in the [Sharran Sanctuary](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sharran_Sanctuary), and taking the dagger will spawn several enemies.

Criminal.name: An Absolute Douceur
Criminal.description:
Accept the Absolute's promise of gifts.
Can be triggered by cooperating with [Marcus](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Marcus_Falgor) to abduct [Isobel](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Isobel_Thorm) from [Last Light Inn](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Last_Light_Inn).

Criminal.name: Body Heist
Criminal.description: Open and loot the [mind flayer colony's vault](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mind_Flayer_Colony#Necrotic_Laboratory).

Criminal.name: Fickle Allegiances
Criminal.description: Betray [Balthazar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Balthazar) after learning that Nightsong is not a simple relic.

Criminal.name: Supply and Demand
Criminal.description: Offer to kick the squatters out for a lower fee than the Rivington Rats.

Criminal.name: Wrongly Convicted
Criminal.description: Break Counsellor Florrick out of Wyrm's Rock.

Criminal.name: Saving It From Collecting Dust
Criminal.description: Steal an offering to the gods.

Entertainer.name: Chicken Chase Extraordinaire
Entertainer.description:
Win a match of chicken chase.
Can be won fairly, using [Command: Approach](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Command:_Approach), or with [Speak with Animals](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Speak_with_Animals) using persuasion to guide the creature to the post.

Entertainer.name: Celebrant
Entertainer.description:
Enjoy a dance in camp with the [tieflings](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Rescue_the_Druid_Halsin#Claiming_the_Rewards).
Dance with [Zae](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Zae), a Tiefling who only appears if [Lakrissa](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lakrissa) has been killed or knocked out.

Entertainer.name: The Price of Ink
Entertainer.description: Free [Oskar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Oskar) the painter from the Zhentarim.

Entertainer.name: Heart of the Creator
Entertainer.description:
Perform in a play with [Bernard](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Bernard) the automaton.
Choose any of the dialogue options granted by reading the various books throughout the [Arcane Tower](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Arcane_Tower).

Entertainer.name: Plucking the Lyre's Web
Entertainer.description: Play the [Spider's Lyre](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Spider%27s_Lyre) to attract the drider.

Entertainer.name: A Story You Won't Believe
Entertainer.description: Pass all [Performance](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Performance) [checks](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ability_check) when telling a tall tale to [the brewer](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Thisobald_Thorm).

Entertainer.name: Danse Macabre
Entertainer.description: Make the [gnolls](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/%27Barnabus%27) stay under the influence of [their master](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Linsella).

Entertainer.name: Giving a Private Performance
Entertainer.description:
Receive a service at Sharess' Caress.
Accept a free drink from [Hoots Hooligan](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Hoots_Hooligan)
Experience 'rapture' from [Naoise Nallinto](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Naoise_Nallinto)
Hire either [Nym Orlith](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Nym_Orlith) or [Sorn Orlith](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sorn_Orlith) or both

Entertainer.name: At Least They Didn't Throw Overripe Bananas...
Entertainer.description: Lose the comedy contest in the [Elfsong Tavern](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Elfsong_Tavern).

Folk Hero.name: A Timely Rescue
Folk Hero.description: Save [Findal](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Findal) from the goblins who kidnapped him.

Folk Hero.name: The Most Unfortunate Gnome
Folk Hero.description: Rescue [the gnome](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Barcus_Wroot) from his fate at the windmill.

Folk Hero.name: Fate Worse Than Death
Folk Hero.description: Save [Liam](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Liam) from his goblin torturers.

Folk Hero.name: Rescued from the Flames
Folk Hero.description:
Save whoever you can from [Waukeen's Rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Waukeen%27s_Rest).
Despite the description, saving either [Florrick](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Florrick) or [Benryn](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Benryn) grants it, even if the other one is still alive and blocked inside.

Folk Hero.name: Unmasking the Truth
Folk Hero.description: Free the [Mask of Regret](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mask_of_Regret_(Overgrown_Tunnel)), one of the Hag's masked thralls

Folk Hero.name: A Lethal Endeavour
Folk Hero.description: Escort [Baelen](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Baelen) out of the field of bibberbangs.

Folk Hero.name: Breaker of Chains
Folk Hero.description: Save the deep gnomes from [Nere](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Nere) and the duergar.

Folk Hero.name: Not Another Soul
Folk Hero.description: Keep all Harpers alive during the ambush with the Shadows.

Folk Hero.name: A Smile Better Suits...
Folk Hero.description: Offer a hopeful response to [Alfira](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Alfira)'s inquiry.

Folk Hero.name: Saving the Prodigious
Folk Hero.description: Save [Rolan](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Rolan) from the Shadow-Cursed Lands.

Folk Hero.name: No Strings to Hold Them Back
Folk Hero.description: Release the [gnolls](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Barnabus) from their enslavement.

Folk Hero.name: Breakout!
Folk Hero.description: Break out and save all of the [Moonrise](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Moonrise_Towers) prisoners.

Folk Hero.name: Damsel No More
Folk Hero.description: Free [Nightsong](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Aylin).

Folk Hero.name: Securing Hospitality
Folk Hero.description: Save the squatters from being kicked out.

Folk Hero.name: Diplomatic Rescue
Folk Hero.description: [Save Counsellor Florrick](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Free_Counsellor_Florrick) from Wyrm's Rock.

Folk Hero.name: Wyrmslayers
Folk Hero.description: Challenge and defeat [Ansur](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ansur), the not-so-immortal sentinel of Wyrm's Crossing.

Folk Hero.name: Painted Hero
Folk Hero.description: Obtain your portrait from [Oskar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Free_the_Artist).

Folk Hero.name: Against All Odds
Folk Hero.description: Rescue all thirteen captured Gondians' family members before the turn limit expires.

Folk Hero.name: Freeing the Preyed
Folk Hero.description: Free [Hope](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Hope) from captivity.

Folk Hero.name: End of the Tribunal
Folk Hero.description: Save [Valeria](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Valeria) and end the Murder Tribunal.

Guild Artisan.name: Valued Customer
Guild Artisan.description: Trade with someone who has High approval of you.

Guild Artisan.name: The Spider's Gift
Guild Artisan.description:
Identify the [drow armour](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Faded_Drow_Leather_Armour) near [Waukeen's Rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Waukeen%27s_Rest).
This requires the armour to be picked up with a Drow, Duergar, Deep Gnome, or any character with +5 to [History](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/History) or higher in the party.

Guild Artisan.name: An Acquired Taste
Guild Artisan.description:
Drink one of [Ethel's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Auntie_Ethel) unique potions.
[Heart of Stone](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Heart_of_Stone) or [A Mother's Loathing](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/A_Mother%27s_Loathing) are recommended, as the others have negative effects.

Guild Artisan.name: Regeneration
Guild Artisan.description: Restore power to the elevator in the [Arcane Tower](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Arcane_Tower).

Guild Artisan.name: Art Endures
Guild Artisan.description: Craft something in the Adamantine Forge.

Guild Artisan.name: Trust and a Little Pixie Dust
Guild Artisan.description: Investigate the Moonlantern and find its power source.

Guild Artisan.name: Hellish Armaments
Guild Artisan.description: Obtain a piece of infernal equipment from [Dammon](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Dammon).

Guild Artisan.name: Confiscated Works
Guild Artisan.description: Acquire a [magical item](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Fireheart) from the [toll collector's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Reithwin_Tollhouse) confiscation chest.

Guild Artisan.name: Blood, Sweat, and the Other Thing
Simple Tools, Great Works
Guild Artisan.description:
Return [Wulbren's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Wulbren_Bongle) tools to him.
This doesn't need to be his hammer that was confiscated; any bludgeoning weapon, including the club that Wulbren can pick up on the docks, will award this Inspiration.

Guild Artisan.name: Mating Season
Guild Artisan.description:
Discover the source of the [displacer beast's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Nessa) infatuation.
Investigate the spider carcass near [Yurgir](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Yurgir).

Guild Artisan.name: Alternative Vocations
Guild Artisan.description:
Partake in a service from [Sharess' Caress](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sharess%27_Caress):
Accept a free drink from [Hoots Hooligan](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Hoots_Hooligan)
Experience 'rapture' from [Naoise Nallinto](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Naoise_Nallinto)
Hire either [Nym Orlith](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Nym_Orlith) or [Sorn Orlith](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sorn_Orlith) or both

Guild Artisan.name: Extravagance Required
Guild Artisan.description: Acquire an exquisite new outfit from Figaro's.

Haunted One.name: Indulge Thine Appetites
Haunted One.description:
Follow your Dark Urge.
There are many different opportunities to get this one, generally by choosing dialogue options related to giving in to the urges, but only the first time you do this will actually grant inspiration.
Interaction catalysts include: Rescuing Gale, Timber, Arabella, Wounded Bird, Okta, Remira, Pandirna, Zevlor, Lady Esther, Blood of Lathander, and the Strange Ox in Act 2, among others.

Haunted One.name: To Sleep, Perchance To Dream Tentacled Dreams
Haunted One.description: Close the pinned mind flayer's eyes forever.

Haunted One.name: Creatures of Bloodlust
Haunted One.description: Recruit the [ogre mercenaries](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lump_the_Enlightened), using the corpses of your enemies as payment.

Haunted One.name: Good Ol' Long Pig
Haunted One.description: Eat a chunk of the cooked dwarf.

Haunted One.name: Fly-Swatter
Haunted One.description:
Kill the [trickster pixie](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Dolly_Dolly_Dolly).
This can also be triggered by arriving to Moonrise Towers with Kar'niss' convoy.

Haunted One.name: Lack of Moderation is Key
Haunted One.description: Kill the [brewer](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Thisobald_Thorm) with his own brew.

Haunted One.name: Soulful Lobotomy
Haunted One.description:
[Torture Minthara](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Decide_Minthara%27s_Fate), reducing her to a husk of her former self.
Requires erasing Minthara's mind yourself; letting the Inquisitors do it does not grant Inspiration.

Haunted One.name: Cleaning Up The Scum
Haunted One.description: Kill both of the opposing smuggling factions.

Haunted One.name: Weak Gifts for Weak Beings
Haunted One.description: Take the [measly offerings](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Stormshore_Tabernacle) to the gods for yourself.

Haunted One.name: Homecoming
Haunted One.description: Discover the Temple of Bhaal beneath Baldur's Gate.

Noble.name: Dragon's Hoard
Noble.description: Have at least 2000 gold among the party.

Noble.name: Lest Ye Be Judged
Noble.description: Learn [Astarion](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Astarion)'s history as a magistrate. This only works if doing it as player character, and it does not work with mercenaries.

Noble.name: A Man of Many Talents
Noble.description: Expand your retinue by bringing [Volo](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Volo) to camp.

Noble.name: Entitled
Noble.description:
Earn a title from your deeds.
Can be awarded from completing:
[Defeat the Duergar Intruders](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Defeat_the_Duergar_Intruders) for [Sovereign Spaw](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Spaw).
[Investigate Kagha](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Investigate_Kagha) while persuading Kagha to abandon the [Shadow Druids](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Shadow_Druids).

Noble.name: Noble Feline
Noble.description: Speak with the [lordly cat](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/His_Majesty) at Last Light.

Noble.name: Odd Entourage
Noble.description: Complete the drider escort to Moonrise

Noble.name: Taxes? Never Heard of 'Em
Noble.description: Don't give any gold to the [toll collector](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gerringothe_Thorm).

Noble.name: Meat Shield
Noble.description: Obtain Balthazar's bell and summon his flesh golem.

Noble.name: Updating Your Wardrobe
Noble.description: Obtain a sumptuous new garment from [Figaro's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Figaro_Pennygood).

Noble.name: An Apocalyptic Deal
Noble.description:
Convince someone to [aid you during the endgame](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gather_Your_Allies) or by making a deal with [Raphael](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Raphael)
Can be awarded by:
Convincing [Mol](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mol) or [Nine-Fingers](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Nine-Fingers) to aid you in the battle for Baldur's Gate.
Defeat Raphael in the House of Hope, first convincing [Yurgir](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Yurgir) to join you.
Siding with [Wulbren Bongle](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Wulbren_Bongle) during [Disable the Steel Watch](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Disable_the_Steel_Watch).
Recruit [Auntie Ethel](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Auntie_Ethel) as an ally for [Gather Your Allies](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gather_Your_Allies).

Outlander.name: A Mother's Fury
Outlander.description:
Triumph over the mother [Owlbear](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Owlbear).
Does not require actually fighting the Owlbear. Convincing her not to attack using [Speak with Animals](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Speak_with_Animals) is sufficient.

Outlander.name: Rock Steady
Outlander.description:
Survive the bandit's rolling boulder trap.
The description is misleading; disarming the two tripwire traps awards the inspiration, while getting hit by the boulder and surviving does not. Getting around the traps (by e.g. jumping) awards the inspiration as well.

Outlander.name: Eyes of the Wild
Outlander.description: See past the illusion covering the swamp.

Outlander.name: A Noble Endeavour
Outlander.description:
Effectively use a noblestalk mushroom.
This can be accomplished by giving the mushroom to Derryth, Shadowheart, or Baelen, or by [The Dark Urge](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/The_Dark_Urge) using it themselves.

Outlander.name: The Floor Is Lava
Outlander.description: Defeat the [Lava Elemental](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lava_Elemental) in the lava lake.

Outlander.name: Child's Play
Outlander.description: Beat [Oliver](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Oliver) at hide and seek without alerting the shadow creatures.

Outlander.name: Grove Keeper's Keeper
Outlander.description: Protect [Halsin](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Halsin)'s portal while he saves the spirit of the land.

Outlander.name: I've Had Worse
Outlander.description: Successfully drink and resist the negative effects of [the brewer](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Thisobald_Thorm)'s concoction.

Outlander.name: Path Least Followed
Outlander.description: Complete the Gauntlet of Shar without going to Last Light or Moonrise.

Outlander.name: From Head to Toe
Outlander.description:
Explore all sections of the mind flayer colony.
Awarded upon following Ketheric to the lower level.

Sage.name: Reanimator
Sage.description: Correctly follow [Gale](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gale)'s instructions to resurrect him. (Only if Gale is your OC.[[Needs Verification](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/bg3wiki:Verification)])

Sage.name: Secrets of the Sundering
Sage.description: Unlock and read the [Book of Dead Gods](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Book_of_Dead_Gods).

Sage.name: Roots of the Grove
Sage.description:
Learn local history from the druidic frescos.
Requires passing Skill checks ( DC 5 [History](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/History) [check](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ability_check),  DC 10 [Intelligence](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Intelligence) [check](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ability_check) and  DC 10 [Religion](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Religion) [check](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ability_check) x2) on all four tablets describing frescos in the Inner Sanctum of the Emerald Grove
Granted, too, if the checks are passed by different party members

Sage.name: A Natural Alliance
Sage.description:
Recognise the druid and Harper armour.
Located underneath the broken bridge to the north of the blighted village.

Sage.name: If I Can't Have It...
Sage.description:
Discover the secrets of the the [Adamantine Forge](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Adamantine_Forge_(quest)) from all three drow wizards.
Pass the ability checks on the following 3 items:

[Memory Shard](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Memory_Shard)
[Scribbled Notes](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Scribbled_Notes)
[The Great Furnace of Grymforge](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/The_Great_Furnace_of_Grymforge)

Sage.name: Corrupted Beyond Recognition
Sage.description:
Find and read the [dead druid's journal](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Dead_Druid%27s_Journal) about how the shadow curse came to be.
Located in the top north-eastern part of the map

Sage.name: History Never Forgets
Sage.description: Open the way into the [Gauntlet of Shar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gauntlet_of_Shar).

Sage.name: Brain Blast!
Sage.description: Successfully complete the mind puzzle in the mind flayer colony.

Sage.name: New Normal
Sage.description: Let yourself be scanned by a [Steel Watcher](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Steel_Watcher).

Sage.name: Coronation of the Dreadmaster
Sage.description: Meet [Gortash](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Enver_Gortash) in Wyrm's Rock and witness his coronation.

Sage.name: An Exotic Charter
Sage.description:
Obtain access to the [House of Hope](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/House_of_Hope) portal.
Granted after actually entering the House of Hope through the portal

Soldier.name: One For The Ages
Soldier.description:
Survive a fight in which you kill ten or more enemies.
Summoned creatures that disappear when their summoner dies count toward this.

Soldier.name: No One Left Behind
Soldier.description:
Ensure all of the [Grove's](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Secluded_Grove) defenders survive the first goblin assault.
[Kanon](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Kanon) dying in the prior cutscene does not prevent getting this.

Soldier.name: A Headless Horde
Soldier.description:
Kill every leader in the goblin camp.
[Dror Ragzlin](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Dror_Ragzlin), [Gut](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gut), and [Minthara](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Minthara) are the relevant leaders.

Soldier.name: Conquer the Conquerors
Soldier.description:
Defeat the Githyanki raiding squad.
Requires actually fighting them; a peaceful resolution will not grant inspiration.

Soldier.name: Drowned in the Dark
Soldier.description: Defeat the [duergar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Duergar) patrolling on the Ebonlake.

Soldier.name: An Apple a Day Keeps the Scalpel Away
Soldier.description: Defeat the [Surgeon](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Malus_Thorm) without being operated upon.

Soldier.name: Notched Armour
Soldier.description: Show off your prowess to the [bugbear merchant](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lann_Tarv).

Soldier.name: Know Thine Enemy
Soldier.description: Defeat yourself in the [Gauntlet of Shar](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Gauntlet_of_Shar)'s mirror trial.

Soldier.name: Love That Smell
Soldier.description: Aid the deep gnomes and use the Runepowder Bomb to blow up the [Steel Watch Foundry](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Steel_Watch_Foundry).

Urchin.name: Hunger Never Fades
Urchin.description:
Fill your plate at [Raphael](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Raphael)'s [House of Hope](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/House_of_Hope).
On the first introduction cutscene, choose the option Ignore him and fill your plate.

Urchin.name: Artful Dodger
Urchin.description:
Earn [Mattis](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mattis)' respect by taking his ring.
The description is misleading; you must perform a DC 15 [Sleight of Hand](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sleight_of_Hand) [check](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ability_check) and then return the ring.

Urchin.name: Pyramid Scheme
Urchin.description: Convince [the ogres](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lump_the_Enlightened) to work for you without giving them gold.

Urchin.name: Born Innocent
Urchin.description: Save the [owlbear cub](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Owlbear_Cub) from the goblins.

Urchin.name: Hero for Hire
Urchin.description: Get some coin out of the [Zhentarim](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Zhentarim) survivors.

Urchin.name: You Can't Take It with You
Urchin.description:
Loot the dead gnomes in [Grymforge](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Grymforge) before their corpses are thrown into the river.
You must specifically acquire the [Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Fetish_of_Callarduran_Smoothhands) in order to get this.

Urchin.name: Child at Heart
Urchin.description: Play both games of hide and seek with [Oliver](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Oliver).

Urchin.name: Orphan Camaraderie
Urchin.description: Help [Mol](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mol) win the game of lanceboard.

Urchin.name: Gone Feral
Urchin.description:
Free the mind-controlled gnolls from [their master](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Linsella).
If you fail the skill check in the conversation, the inspiration can still be obtained through straight up combat.

Urchin.name: Will Not Be Forgotten
Urchin.description:
Escape the [Oubliette](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Oubliette).
As the description hints, this inspiration is awarded when you leave, not when you enter.

Urchin.name: Strength in Cowardice
Urchin.description: Convince [the orthon](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Yurgir) to spare you, for now...

Urchin.name: Amateur Optician
Urchin.description:
Find [Mol's eyepatch](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Mol%27s_Eyepatch).
Located in Balthazar's Necrotic Laboratory

Urchin.name: Never Trust Those Above You
Urchin.description: Defeat [Gortash](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Enver_Gortash) without making a deal with him.
